subject: HowStuffWorks Lifestyle Newsletter May 10, 2007
body:
howstuffworks® | lifestyle May 10, 2007
RSS
   How Paparazzi Work 
 The
worldwide obsession with celebrities has spawned one of the most fascinating yet
reviled by-products of pop culture -- paparazzi.
As our culture's voracious hunger for celebrity snapshots grows, so do the
prices of these photos and the risks paparazzi take to get them. Take a look
inside the world of paparazzi.
Also at HowStuffWorks
 

How the
Papacy Works - More than
one billion Catholics worldwide look to the pope for spiritual leadership.
Learn how a pope gets elected, about the pope's duties and how far his
authority extends.
 
 

How
Samurai Work - The
legend of the samurai continues to permeate our culture, with countless movies
and TV shows dedicated to the subject. How much of what we know about the
samurai is truth, and how much is myth? Find out about the strict warrior code
of the samurai, the honor system that shaped their lives, the weapons and armor
they used and more.
 
 
 
How the ACLU Works - The ACLU is the nation's premier defender of civil liberties, operating for more than 80 years. Learn about the ACLU's history, its controversial cases, the organization's structure and its opponents. 
   This Week's Video

It's
every kid's dream -- a trip to see all of the amazing animals in the zoo. Go
behind the scenes at the North
  Carolina Zoological Park in this video from HowStuffWorks.  This e-mail was sent to ktwarwic@speedy.uwaterloo.ca, by HowStuffWorks
